wikipedia_page.main: Major-General David McDowall CBE (born 16 August 1954) is a former British Army officer who commanded 2nd Division.

response: The 27 February 1995 Zakho bombing killed over 50 people. When the U.S. Army closed its military base in Zakho in 1996, they evacuated several thousand Kurds who had connections to the base and who feared reprisals. Many of them were given asylum in the USA. According to David McDowall, this constituted a sudden brain drain, with Zakho losing many of its most educated citizens.

response: * Major General David McDowall, , late Royal Corps of Signals, 505997.
